AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alpine, Texas: location where agents had experience and towards which the truck was traveling, destination of the truck after turning left onto Highway 90, ending point of the truck's travel route, location of recent narcotics smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States/Mexican border: reference point for determining proximity and reasonable suspicion in the context of vehicle stops and smuggling activities, area where sensors were activated to track a truck's movement, relevant to the case as a physical boundary
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Big Bend National Park: location with unusual traffic patterns on Sunday mornings, where work vehicles typically leave in groups at the end of the work day or week, starting point of the truck's travel route
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marfa Sector Area Operations Center: previous work location of Jay Snodgrass and sector whose Communications notified the agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: previous work location of Jay Snodgrass
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas: state where smuggling activities are taking place
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Highway 385: highway from which most vehicles would continue straight toward Fort Stockton and Interstate 10, known for alien and narcotics smuggling, had vehicle sensors activated in an area less than 50 miles from the border, notorious smuggling route, road at an intersection where the driver stopped
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mississippi: state of origin for a vehicle's license plate
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Kansas: state of origin for a suspicious vehicle's license plate, associated with a smuggling organization transporting marijuana from the Big Bend area, state where the truck's license plate was from, destination of smuggled narcotics
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marathon, Texas: location where the truck drove through at 20 miles per hour
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 90: road where the truck turned left, road with a posted speed limit of 20 miles per hour
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Fort Stockton: destination for most vehicles coming up Highway 385
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate 10: highway toward which most vehicles would continue from Highway 385
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 118: most direct and logical route of travel from Big Bend to Alpine
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.district court: court that denied Brignoni-Ponce Jacquinot's motion and sentenced him, also reviewed the denial of a motion to suppress
